units.title: Sample placement on 96-well superstructure
units.text: sections were placed on a 96-well format coverslip that was subsequently attached ... to a 96-well superstructure allowing immunohistological treatment, followed by imaging and antibody elution.
units.rationale: Describes how samples are arranged for multiplexed immunostaining.

units.title: 21-cycle immunohistochemical workflow
units.text: We performed 21 immunohistochemical cycles (39 weeks) ... Acquire ... Denoise ... Elute antibodies - Register - Pixel cluster
units.rationale: Outlines the repeated staining, imaging, and processing steps.

units.title: Multiplexed immunohistochemistry on FFPE sections
units.text: We performed multiplexed immunohistochemistry on 3-μm-thick formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) sections (1–4 sections per sample; Supplementary Table 1 and Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: Specifies the tissue preparation and staining protocol.

units.title: Imaging parameters for tiled acquisition
units.text: We generated tiled images at ×40 magnification with a high-numerical-aperture silicone oil objective to cover length scales from the millimeter to the nanometer scale (pixel size, 0.1625 μm).
units.rationale: Provides the microscope settings for high‑resolution image capture.

units.title: Antibody panel establishment
units.text: We established a panel of 63 antibodies covering major retinal cell types, subcellular compartments, morphological structures and cell types.
units.rationale: Defines the reagent set used for multiplexed protein detection.

units.title: 4i timecourse application
units.text: To establish a spatial retinal organoid reference map, we applied 4i covering a timecourse of human retinal organoid development (6, 12, 18, 24 and 39 weeks; 2–4 organoids per timepoint; Supplementary Table 1).
units.rationale: Describes the experimental design across developmental stages.

units.title: Variance analysis and UMAP visualization
units.text: We performed variance analysis in the protein expression feature space and visualization in a uniform manifold approximation and projection (UMAP) embedding revealed eight molecularly distinct nuclei clusters.
units.rationale: Details the computational analysis to identify cell‑type clusters.

units.title: Mosaic perturbation of transcription factors
units.text: We performed follow‑up mosaic perturbations of selected transcription factors (TFs) and focused on the orthodenticle homeobox 2 (OTX2) regulon.
units.rationale: Explains the functional perturbation experiment to test gene‑regulatory effects.

units.title: Integration of scRNA‑seq and scATAC‑seq data
units.text: We combined this with a dense single‑cell RNA sequencing (scRNA‑seq) and single‑cell assay for transposase‑accessible chromatin using sequencing (scATAC‑seq) dataset covering 6–46 weeks of development.
units.rationale: Links protein maps with transcriptomic and epigenomic profiles.

units.title: Spatial protein map generation
units.text: The digital organoid map can be used to explore spatial interactions over time and predict gene regulatory modules underlying retinal neurogenesis.
units.rationale: Summarizes the purpose of the computational pipeline.
